title: Post With Code
text:
Creating a pandas DataFrame

import pandas as pd

data = {"Name": ["a", "b", "c", "d"],
        "Age": [24, 23, 22, 19]}

data

df = pd.DataFrame(data)
df





  
    
      
      Name
      Age
    
  
  
    
      0
      a
      24
    
    
      1
      b
      23
    
    
      2
      c
      22
    
    
      3
      d
      19
    
  






Selecting a Column

df["Name"]
df[["Name"]] # the difference?





  
    
      
      Name
    
  
  
    
      0
      a
    
    
      1
      b
    
    
      2
      c
    
    
      3
      d
    
  






Selecting a Row

df.loc[1]
df.iloc[1]
?df.iloc



Data Selection, addition

# ?df.insert
df.insert(1, "Sex", "F")
del df["Sex"]
df.insert(2, "Sex", "M")
df





  
    
      
      Name
      Age
      Sex
    
  
  
    
      0
      a
      24
      M
    
    
      1
      b
      23
      M
    
    
      2
      c
      22
      M
    
    
      3
      d
      19
      M
    
  






Working with missing data

import numpy as np
data = {"Name": ['A', np.nan], "Age": [23, np.nan]}

df = pd.DataFrame(data)
df

df.isnull()
df.fillna(0)





  
    
      
      Name
      Age
    
  
  
    
      0
      A
      23.0
    
    
      1
      0
      0.0
    
  










Note



use exit instead of exit() to exit the RStudio Python REPL
